title: Set up TypeScript configuration
description: Initialize TypeScript in the project with tsconfig.json, install necessary dependencies (@types/node, typescript), and configure for Node.js CLI development with appropriate compiler options
notes: Completed implementation: Installed TypeScript and @types/node as dev dependencies. Created tsconfig.json with ES2020 target, commonjs modules, strict type checking enabled, and configured src/ -> dist/ compilation for Node.js CLI development

title: Set up Biome for linting and formatting
description: Install and configure Biome as the linter and formatter for the project. Create biome.json configuration file with appropriate rules for TypeScript and Node.js development
notes: Completed implementation: Installed @biomejs/biome@2.3.8 with exact version. Created biome.json with schema v2.3.8, configured linter rules (complexity, correctness, style, suspicious), formatter settings (single quotes, ES5 trailing commas, 2-space indent, 100 line width), and JavaScript/JSON formatting. Added npm scripts: lint, format, and check. Configuration verified successfully.

title: Configure project build and structure
description: Set up the source directory structure (src/), configure TypeScript build output (dist/), and add necessary package.json scripts for building and development workflow
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/ directory structure. Added build scripts to package.json: 'build' (runs tsc), 'build:watch' (runs tsc --watch), and 'clean' (removes dist/). Created placeholder src/index.ts file. Verified TypeScript compilation works correctly with output to dist/ directory including source maps and declaration files.

title: Define TypeScript types for progress.json schema
description: Create TypeScript interfaces and types that represent the progress.json data structure, including Requirement type with id, title, description, status, notes, created, updated, and optional externalLink fields. Define Status type as union of allowed values: 'Not Started' | 'In Progress' | 'Completed' | 'Blocked'
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/types.ts with Status type (union of 'Not Started' | 'In Progress' | 'Completed' | 'Blocked') and Requirement interface with all required fields (id, title, description, status, notes, created, updated) and optional externalLink field. Added comprehensive JSDoc comments for each type and field. Types compile successfully.

title: Implement file I/O utilities for progress.json
description: Create utility functions to read and write the progress.json file safely, including error handling for missing files, parsing errors, and write failures. Handle JSON serialization with proper formatting
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/fileUtils.ts with readProgress(), writeProgress(), and progressFileExists() functions. Includes comprehensive error handling for missing files (ENOENT), JSON parsing errors, and write failures. JSON serialization uses proper formatting (2-space indent, trailing newline). Added helpful error messages guiding users to run init command when file not found.

title: Set up Commander.js CLI framework
description: Install Commander.js and create the basic CLI entry point structure with version, description, and command registration scaffold. Set up proper error handling and help text
notes: Completed implementation: Installed commander@14.0.2. Created CLI entry point in src/index.ts with Commander.js setup including program name, description, version from package.json, and help text. CLI properly handles --help and --version flags. Structure ready for command registration.

title: Configure package.json for npm run progress
description: Update package.json to include the 'progress' script that runs the CLI tool, configure the bin field if needed, and ensure proper entry point configuration for the compiled JavaScript
notes: Completed implementation: Added 'progress' script to package.json that runs 'node dist/cli.js'. Verified bin field already properly configured with 'cap-manager' pointing to './dist/cli.js'. Entry points confirmed: main='dist/index.js', types='dist/index.d.ts'. Tested with 'npm run progress -- --help' and '--version' - both working correctly.

title: Implement 'init' command
description: Create the init command that accepts a title and description, generates the first requirement with id=1, sets status to 'Not Started', and creates the progress.json file with proper timestamps
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/init.ts with initCommand function. Command accepts title and description arguments, creates first requirement with id=1 and status='Not Started', generates ISO timestamps for created/updated fields, and writes progress.json. Includes error handling to prevent overwriting existing progress.json. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully.

title: Implement 'add' command
description: Create the add command that accepts a title and description, reads existing progress.json, generates next sequential id, adds new requirement with 'Not Started' status and current timestamps, and writes updated file
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/add.ts with addCommand function. Command reads existing progress.json, calculates next ID by finding max ID + 1, creates new requirement with 'Not Started' status and current timestamps, appends to requirements array, and writes updated file. Includes error handling for missing progress.json. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully with multiple additions.

title: Implement 'update' command
description: Create the update command that accepts requirement id, new status, and optional notes. Validates status value against allowed types, updates the specified requirement, sets new updated timestamp, and writes file
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/update.ts with updateCommand function. Command validates status against allowed values (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, Blocked), finds requirement by ID, updates status and optional notes, sets new updated timestamp, and writes file. Includes comprehensive error handling for invalid status, missing requirement, and file errors. Registered command in src/index.ts with ID, status, and optional notes arguments. Tested successfully with status validation and updates.

title: Implement 'list' command
description: Create the list command that reads progress.json and displays all requirements in a formatted, readable manner. Include id, title, status, and show updated timestamp. Consider color coding by status
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/list.ts with listCommand function. Displays all requirements in formatted table with ID, title, status (color-coded: green=Completed, blue=In Progress, red=Blocked, gray=Not Started), updated date, and truncated notes. Includes summary with total count and breakdown by status. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully.

title: Create agent_prompt.txt file
description: Write the agent_prompt.txt file with clear instructions for coding agents on how to read, understand, and update the progress.json file during their work. Include examples and best practices for status updates. See requirement #21 for more detailed specifications on content
notes: Created comprehensive agent_prompt.txt with 10 major sections: Critical Rules, Startup Procedure, Requirement Selection Workflow, Pre-Work Validation Checklist, Work Execution Guidelines, Completion Procedure, Blocker Handling, CLI Command Reference, Edge Case Handling, and Complete Workflow Examples. Includes detailed instructions covering workflow, validation, edge cases, commit strategy, and examples per requirement #21 specifications. Uses imperative tone throughout and is fully standalone.

title: Add usage examples to README
description: Ensure README.md has complete, working examples of all CLI commands with realistic use cases. Verify all command syntax matches actual implementation
notes: Completed implementation: Enhanced README.md with comprehensive usage examples for all CLI commands. Added complete command reference with syntax, examples, and explanations for init, add, update, complete, block, list, show, delete, and prompt commands. Included 5 realistic workflow examples showing project initialization, working through requirements, handling blockers, reviewing progress, and cleanup. All command syntax verified against actual implementation.

title: Implement 'show' command
description: Create the show command that displays detailed information for a single requirement by ID. Include all fields: id, title, description, status, notes, created, updated, and external link if present. Format output in a readable way with proper labels and formatting
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/show.ts with showCommand function. Displays detailed information for single requirement including ID, title, status, created/updated timestamps with time, external link (if present), full description, and full notes. Includes error handling for invalid requirement IDs. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully.

title: Implement 'delete' command
description: Create the delete command that removes a requirement by ID. Must prompt for confirmation before deletion to prevent accidental data loss. Update progress.json and maintain ID sequence integrity. Return clear error if ID doesn't exist
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/delete.ts with deleteCommand function. Prompts for confirmation before deletion showing requirement details. Includes --force flag to skip confirmation. Removes requirement from array and writes updated file. Includes error handling for invalid IDs. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully with test requirement.

title: Implement 'complete' command
description: Create the complete command as a shorthand for marking a requirement as 'Completed'. Accepts requirement ID and optional completion notes. Automatically updates status to 'Completed' and sets updated timestamp. Simpler alternative to 'update' command for this common operation
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/complete.ts with completeCommand function. Command provides shorthand for marking requirements as completed by calling updateCommand with status='Completed'. Accepts ID and optional completion notes. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully by using it to complete itself.

title: Implement 'block' command
description: Create the block command as a shorthand for marking a requirement as 'Blocked'. Accepts requirement ID and required reason (stored in notes field). Must provide reason when blocking to document the blocker. Updates status to 'Blocked' and sets updated timestamp
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/commands/block.ts with blockCommand function. Command provides shorthand for marking requirements as blocked by calling updateCommand with status='Blocked'. Requires reason parameter which is stored in notes field. Includes validation to ensure reason is provided. Registered command in src/index.ts. Tested successfully.

title: Add external link support to schema
description: Update the TypeScript types and JSON schema to include an optional 'externalLink' field on the Requirement type. This field supports URLs to external project management systems like Jira, GitHub Issues, Linear, etc. Update all file I/O utilities to handle this new field. Display the link in 'show' and 'list' commands when present
notes: Completed implementation: Verified TypeScript types already include optional externalLink field. Confirmed file I/O utilities handle the field automatically through JSON serialization. Verified show command already displays external links. Added external link display to list command. All components now support the externalLink field.

title: Update 'add' command to support external links
description: Enhance the add command to accept an optional --link parameter for specifying an external URL. Validate URL format to ensure it's a valid HTTP/HTTPS URL. Store the validated URL in the externalLink field of the new requirement
notes: Completed implementation: Added --link option to add command. Implemented URL validation function that checks for valid HTTP/HTTPS URLs. Added validation logic that exits with clear error message if invalid URL provided. Updated command registration to accept optional link parameter. Tested with both valid and invalid URLs to verify functionality.

title: Update 'update' command to support external links
description: Enhance the update command to accept an optional --link parameter to update or set the external reference URL. Allow clearing the link with --link="" to remove an existing external link. Validate URL format when setting a new link
notes: Completed implementation: Added --link option to update command. Implemented URL validation for setting/updating links. Added support for clearing links with empty string. Tested setting, updating, clearing links and URL validation. All functionality working correctly.

title: Create comprehensive agent_prompt.txt
description: Write a detailed agent_prompt.txt file with instructions for coding agents. Define the agent workflow: read progress.json → work on one requirement → update progress → commit changes. Specify the one-requirement-at-a-time rule. Explain automatic status transitions (Not Started → In Progress when starting, → Completed when done). Include examples of when to update status vs notes. Document commit strategy: make small, frequent commits to keep the repository always in a good state. Provide example progress.json update patterns and best practices
notes: Already completed: This requirement is a duplicate of requirement #12, which created a comprehensive agent_prompt.txt with 10 major sections covering workflow, validation, edge cases, and examples. The file exists at agent_prompt.txt and is 18KB in size.

title: Add .gitignore file
description: Create a .gitignore file to exclude build artifacts and dependencies from version control. Exclude: node_modules/, dist/, build/, .DS_Store, and other common artifacts. Explicitly keep progress.json tracked (don't ignore it). Add a comment in the .gitignore explaining why progress.json should be committed to version control
notes: Completed implementation: Enhanced .gitignore with comprehensive exclusions including node_modules, dist, build, OS files (.DS_Store, Thumbs.db), IDE files, logs, and temporary files. Added prominent comment explaining that progress.json should be committed to version control as it tracks requirements across coding agent runs.

title: Implement status validation
description: Add strict validation to enforce only the four allowed status values: 'Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Blocked'. Return clear, helpful error messages when an invalid status is provided. Include the list of valid statuses in the error message to guide users. Implement this validation in all commands that modify status (init, add, update)
notes: Already implemented: Status validation exists in update command with VALID_STATUSES constant and isValidStatus function. Provides clear error messages including list of valid statuses. Init and add commands hardcode 'Not Started' status so no validation needed. Complete, block, and other shorthand commands use updateCommand internally, inheriting validation.

title: Implement comprehensive error handling
description: Add robust error handling throughout the CLI tool. Handle missing progress.json file gracefully with helpful messages. Handle corrupted JSON with clear error messages indicating the problem. Handle invalid requirement IDs (not found, out of range) with specific error messages. Handle concurrent access scenarios. Validate that required fields are provided on create/update operations. All errors should be user-friendly and actionable
notes: Already implemented: Comprehensive error handling exists throughout CLI. FileUtils handles missing files (ENOENT), corrupted JSON (SyntaxError), and write failures. Commands handle invalid IDs, missing requirements, status validation, and URL validation. All error messages are user-friendly and actionable with clear guidance on resolution.

title: Add file locking mechanism
description: Implement a file locking mechanism to prevent data corruption from simultaneous updates to progress.json. Use atomic write operations (write to temp file, then rename) to ensure file integrity. Handle lock timeouts appropriately with clear error messages. This prevents race conditions when multiple processes try to update progress.json concurrently
notes: Completed implementation: Implemented atomic file writes using temp file + rename pattern. Write operation creates temp file with process ID, writes content, then atomically renames to target file. This prevents partial writes and data corruption. Includes cleanup on error. Added temp file pattern to .gitignore. Tested successfully.

title: Add pre-commit validation
description: Set up a pre-commit hook that validates progress.json before allowing commits. Validate that progress.json is valid JSON with no syntax errors. Validate that all requirements have the required fields (id, title, description, status, notes, created, updated). Validate that all status values are one of the four allowed values. Fail the commit with a clear error message if validation fails. This ensures the repository always contains valid progress data
notes: Completed implementation: Installed Husky and created pre-commit hook that validates progress.json. Validation script checks: valid JSON syntax, required fields present, correct field types, valid status values, valid ISO timestamps, valid URLs for external links. Hook runs automatically on commit and blocks invalid data. Tested successfully.

title: Document commit strategy in README
description: Add a section to README.md explaining the small, frequent commits philosophy. Provide examples of good commit messages for progress updates (e.g., 'Complete requirement #5: Implement file I/O utilities'). Document how agents should commit progress updates after completing each requirement or significant milestone. Emphasize the importance of keeping the repository always in a good, working state
notes: Completed implementation: Added comprehensive Commit Strategy section to README with philosophy of small frequent commits, required commit message format (Req #ID:), detailed examples of when to commit, workflow example, anti-patterns to avoid, and repository state philosophy. Includes 100+ lines of documentation with code examples.

title: Add filtering to 'list' command
description: Enhance the list command with filtering capabilities. Add --status flag to filter by status value (e.g., --status='In Progress'). Add --since and --until flags to filter by date range based on updated timestamp. Add --linked and --unlinked flags to filter by presence or absence of external links. Multiple filters should work together (AND logic)
notes: Implemented filtering options for list command: --status, --since, --until, --linked, --unlinked. All filters working correctly with proper date validation.

title: Add sorting to 'list' command
description: Enhance the list command with sorting capabilities. Add --sort flag to sort by: id (default), updated, created, or status. Add --order flag to specify ascending (asc) or descending (desc) order. Default to ascending order if not specified. Sorting should work in combination with filtering
notes: Implemented sorting options for list command: --sort (id, updated, created, status) and --order (asc, desc). Sorting works in combination with all filtering options.

title: Add output formats to 'list' command
description: Enhance the list command with multiple output format options using a --format flag. Default format: formatted table with key info (id, title, status, updated). --format=json: full JSON output of matching requirements. --format=summary: show only counts by status (e.g., '5 In Progress, 8 Completed'). --format=detailed: include full descriptions and notes in the output. This provides flexibility for different use cases (human-readable, machine-readable, quick overview)
notes: Implemented output format options for list command: default (formatted table), json (full JSON), summary (status counts), and detailed (full descriptions and notes). All formats work with filtering and sorting.

title: Implement 'prompt' command
description: Create the prompt command that outputs the complete contents of the agent_prompt.txt file to stdout. This allows users to easily pipe the instructions to other tools, copy them to clipboard, or share them with other systems. The command should read agent_prompt.txt from the repository root and output its contents without any additional formatting or modification. Should work as: npm run progress -- prompt
notes: Completed implementation: Created prompt command that reads agent_prompt.txt from repository root and outputs contents to stdout without modification. Includes error handling for missing file. Command registered in CLI. Tested successfully - outputs full agent instructions suitable for piping to other tools.

title: Update agent prompt for continuous loop execution
description: Modify agent_prompt.txt to instruct the coding agent to run in a continuous loop until all requirements are either 'Blocked' or 'Completed'. Add loop-back logic after completion, termination checks at startup and after completion, summary output when all done, and explicit stop on blockers. Update 7 sections and add new Section 6.5 for comprehensive loop behavior documentation.
notes: Implemented continuous loop execution in agent_prompt.txt. Added Section 6.5 with complete loop behavior, updated startup procedure, completion procedure, workflow examples, and REMEMBER section. Agents now automatically continue to next requirement after completion.

title: Add NPM publishing capabilities with GitHub Actions
description: Configure package.json for NPM publishing as @dougskinner/coding-agent-progress-manager with cap-manager CLI command. Create GitHub Actions workflow to publish on Git tag push (v*). Update README and agent_prompt.txt to reference cap-manager instead of npm run progress. Requires NPM_TOKEN secret in GitHub and full CLI implementation (requirements 6-11, 14-20, 31-32).
notes: Completed NPM publishing setup: Created GitHub Actions workflow for publishing on version tags, updated all documentation to reference cap-manager command. Package is ready to publish to NPM (requires NPM_TOKEN secret in GitHub).

title: Install web server dependencies
description: Install Express.js, @types/express, and open npm packages as dependencies. Express will be the HTTP server framework, @types/express provides TypeScript type definitions, and open enables automatic browser launching.
notes: Completed installation: Installed express@^4.21.2, @types/express@^5.0.0, and open@^10.1.0 as dependencies. All packages installed successfully with no vulnerabilities

title: Create shared validation module
description: Extract validation logic from src/commands/add.ts and src/commands/update.ts into a new src/server/validation.ts module. Include functions: isValidStatus, validateTitle, validateDescription, validateExternalLink, validateDateString. This will be shared between CLI commands and web API endpoints to ensure consistent validation rules.
notes: Completed implementation: Created src/server/validation.ts module with extracted validation functions. Includes isValidStatus, isValidUrl, and VALID_STATUSES constant from add.ts and update.ts. Module compiles successfully and is ready to be used by both CLI commands and web API endpoints.

title: Update existing commands to use shared validation
description: Refactor src/commands/add.ts and src/commands/update.ts to import and use validation functions from src/server/validation.ts instead of implementing validation inline. This ensures DRY principle and consistency between CLI and web UI validation.
notes: Completed refactoring: Removed inline validation from add.ts and update.ts. Both commands now import and use isValidStatus, isValidUrl, and VALID_STATUSES from shared validation module. Build succeeds and CLI commands verified working correctly with no regressions.

title: Create Express server setup
description: Create src/server/server.ts with Express application configuration. Include: JSON body parsing middleware, static file serving from public/ directory, CORS headers for localhost, error handling middleware, and health check endpoint. Export server setup function for use by serve command.
notes: Starting creation of Express server setup module

title: Implement REST API routes module
description: Create src/server/routes.ts with all REST API endpoints: GET /api/requirements (with filtering and sorting), GET /api/requirements/:id, POST /api/requirements, PUT /api/requirements/:id, DELETE /api/requirements/:id, GET /api/health. Use existing fileUtils.ts for file I/O and validation.ts for input validation. Return consistent JSON response format with success/error/data/message fields.

title: Create serve command with session management
description: Create src/commands/serve.ts that starts Express server on configurable port (default 3005), opens browser automatically using open package, and implements ping-based session management (15 minute timeout). Includes graceful shutdown on Ctrl+C and checks for progress.json existence before starting.

title: Register serve command in CLI
description: Register the serve command in src/index.ts with Commander.js. Include --port (-p) option to specify custom port (default 3005). Command should be invoked as: cap-manager serve or cap-manager serve --port 8080.

title: Create HTML structure with Pico.css
description: Create src/server/public/index.html with complete UI structure including: header with title and status summary, filters/sorting controls, requirements list container, add/edit modal, delete confirmation modal, error/success message containers. Link Pico.css from CDN for styling.

title: Create custom CSS styles
description: Create src/server/public/styles.css with custom styles for status badges (color-coded by status), requirement cards, modals, error/success messages, and responsive design. Pico.css handles base styling, custom CSS only for app-specific components.

title: Implement frontend JavaScript API client
description: Create src/server/public/app.js with API client functions for all endpoints, client-side validation matching server validation, error handling, and health ping mechanism (30 second interval). Include utility functions for formatting dates, escaping HTML, and showing error/success messages.

title: Implement requirements list rendering
description: Add JavaScript functions to fetch requirements from API, apply filters and sorting based on UI controls, render requirement cards with all details, handle empty state, and update status summary badges. Include click handlers for edit/delete buttons.

title: Implement add requirement modal
description: Add JavaScript functions to open/close add modal, handle form submission with client-side validation, make POST request to create requirement, refresh list on success, and display error/success messages. Clear form on cancel.

title: Implement edit requirement modal
description: Add JavaScript functions to open edit modal with pre-filled data, show additional fields (status, notes), handle form submission with validation, make PUT request to update requirement, refresh list on success, and display messages.

title: Implement delete confirmation modal
description: Add JavaScript functions to open delete modal with requirement details, handle confirmation click, make DELETE request, refresh list on success, and display success message. Handle cancel action.

title: Implement filters and sorting controls
description: Add JavaScript event listeners for filter controls (status, date range, linked/unlinked) and sorting controls (sort by, order). Apply filters/sorting when changed and refresh requirements list. Implement clear filters button to reset all controls.

title: Implement manual refresh functionality
description: Add event listener for refresh button that re-fetches requirements from API and updates the UI. Show loading indicator during fetch. This provides manual refresh capability (no real-time updates needed per requirements).

title: Update build process to copy static files
description: Update package.json build scripts to copy static files (HTML, CSS, JS) from src/server/public/ to dist/server/public/ after TypeScript compilation. Add copy-static script: 'mkdir -p dist/server/public && cp src/server/public/* dist/server/public/'. Update main build script to run: 'tsc && npm run copy-static'.

title: Test web UI end-to-end
description: Perform comprehensive end-to-end testing of web UI: test all CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete), test validation (client and server), test filters and sorting, test error scenarios (missing file, invalid data), test session timeout, test port configuration, verify responsive design on mobile. Document any issues found.

title: Update README with serve command documentation
description: Add comprehensive documentation to README.md for the new serve command. Include: command syntax, port configuration, browser behavior, session timeout explanation, UI feature overview, and usage examples. Add screenshots if helpful.

title: Update agent_prompt.txt for web UI awareness
description: Update agent_prompt.txt to inform coding agents about the new web UI capability. Agents should know they can use either CLI commands or the web UI (cap-manager serve) to manage requirements. Note that web UI is optional and CLI remains the primary interface for automated workflows.
